snippet: A movement advocating “economic democratization” has taken hold as the country’s family-owned conglomerates continue their relentless growth.
abstract: Movement advocating 'economic democratization' has taken hold among owners of small stores in South Korea, as country’s family-owned hypermarkets continue their relentless growth; conglomerates are widely credited with leading South Korea's economic growth, but they are also seen as predators of small business.
lead_paragraph: A movement advocating “economic democratization” has taken hold as the country’s family-owned conglomerates continue their relentless growth.

headline.seo: South Koreans Push Back Against Giant Hypermarkets
headline.main: South Koreans Resist Hypermarkets’ Intrusion on Small Businesses
headline.print_headline: South Koreans Resist Hypermarkets’ Intrusion On Small Businesses
